days.overview: God calls Abram to leave his country and family for a land He will show him. Abram obeys by faith without knowing the destination, trusting God's promise.
days.reflection: When has God called you to step out in faith? How do you respond when you don't know the full plan? What does obedient faith look like?
days.prayer: Ask God for Abraham's faith to obey even when you don't see the full picture.

days.overview: God promises Abram countless descendants though he is childless. Abram believes the Lord, and God counts it to him as righteousness. Faith is credited as righteousness.
days.reflection: What impossible promises are you trusting God for? How is faith counted as righteousness? What does believing God mean?
days.prayer: Thank God for counting faith as righteousness and strengthen your trust in His promises.

days.overview: God establishes His covenant with Abraham, promising to make him the father of many nations and give his descendants the land of Canaan. Abraham's name is changed from Abram.
days.reflection: What does God's covenant reveal about His faithfulness? How does Abraham's name change reflect his identity? What covenant promises do you trust?
days.prayer: Thank God for His covenant faithfulness and for giving you a new identity in Christ.

days.overview: God tests Abraham by commanding him to sacrifice Isaac. Abraham obeys, trusting God to provide. God provides a ram and reaffirms His covenant promises because Abraham did not withhold his son.
days.reflection: How did Abraham's faith show itself in action? What has God asked you to surrender? How do you trust God to provide?
days.prayer: Ask God for faith to obey even when His commands seem impossible to understand.

days.overview: Paul describes Abraham's faithâ€”against hope he believed in hope, not weakened by considering his own body or Sarah's barrenness, fully convinced God could do what He promised.
days.reflection: How did Abraham believe against hope? What obstacles to God's promises do you focus on? How can you be fully convinced of God's power?
days.prayer: Pray for unwavering faith that believes God's promises despite circumstances.

days.overview: The author praises Abraham's faith in obeying the call to an unknown place, dwelling in tents as a stranger, looking forward to the city whose designer and builder is God.
days.reflection: How did faith make Abraham a sojourner? What eternal city are you looking forward to? How does eternal perspective affect earthly living?
days.prayer: Ask God to help you live as a sojourner, longing for the eternal city He has prepared.

days.overview: Abraham's faith was tested when offering Isaac. He reasoned that God could raise the dead, and figuratively speaking, he received Isaac back. Faith trusts God's ability beyond death.
days.reflection: How far does your faith trust God? What does believing God can raise the dead mean? How did Abraham's faith go beyond what seemed possible?
days.prayer: Pray for faith that trusts God's power even beyond death and impossibility.
